official-title.#text:
To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act
		  of 1968 to prohibit funding under the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance
		  grant program and the Public Safety and Community Policing grant program to be
		  provided to law enforcement agencies that use license plate readers unless
		  certain conditions are met.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Reasonable Policies on Automated
			 License Plate Readers Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Funding under
			 Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance grant program and Public Safety and
			 Community Policing grant program prohibited for use by law enforcement agencies
			 that use license plate readers unless certain conditions met

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 501(d) of the Omnibus Crime Control
			 and Safe Streets Act of 1968
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:501/ss:d

header.#text:
Restriction
			 under Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program

text.#text:
Any funds or other assistance to a law
				enforcement agency that uses an automated license plate reader, unless such law
				enforcement agency has developed written and binding policies for the use of
				the reader that ensure data collected by the reader—

is shared with an
				entity other than the law enforcement agency that operates the reader only
				if—

the entity is
				another law enforcement agency;

the data is to be
				used in an active law enforcement investigation; and

the data is
				provided in response to a specific request for the
				data.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section
			 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:1701

header.#text:
Restriction
			 under Public Safety and Community Policing grant program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:1701/ss:b

text.#text: in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:1701/ss:l

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new subsection:

Notwithstanding any other
				provision of this Act, no funds provided under this part may be provided to or
				used, directly or indirectly, by a law enforcement agency that uses an
				automated license plate reader, unless such law enforcement agency has
				developed written and binding policies for the use of the reader that ensure
				data collected by the reader—

is shared with an
				entity other than the law enforcement agency that operates the reader only
				if—

the entity is
				another law enforcement agency;

the data is to be
				used in an active law enforcement investigation; and

the data is
				provided in response to a specific request for the
				data.

The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect
			 to funds provided for grant periods beginning on or after the date that is 90
			 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2644 IH: Reasonable Policies on Automated License Plate Readers Act
